title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: It consists of two hills, the western of which is occupied by an observatory; the eastern, called the Kirkhill, still exhibits the remains of a monastery and a church.

title: Autobiography of Mrs. Fletcher.
author: Fletcher
snippet: " Soon after I went to my Edinburgh home she gave it her blessing, and your father and she used to be our inmates at the cottage at Kirkhill." ,'

title: Travels in Scotland: translated from the German. With notes by the translator [John Kesson]
author: Kohl, Johann Georg.
snippet: Thestrip of coast, thus separated from the Highlands, is here and therescarcely a mile in breadth, and extends from Nairn to Inverness,Kirkhill, Dingwall, Kiltearn, Tain, and finally terminates at Eriderton, on the Frith of Tain.
